tern
  • Reference

Time-to-event Forest Plot Table

Time-to-event Forest Plot Table

t_forest_tte(tte, is_event, col_by, group_data = NULL, strata_data = NULL,
  total = "ALL", time_unit = "month", na.omit.group = TRUE,
  dense_header = FALSE)

Arguments

tte

time to event data
is_event

is boolean, TRUE if event, FALSE if tte is censored
col_by

factor with reference and comparison group information, the first level indicates the reference group
group_data

data frame with one column per grouping

Details

Cox PH model is used for hazard ratio calculation

The returned table contains one row per analysis applied on a subset of data (indicated by the row name). The analysis is summarized with the following 9 columns:

1

Total n the total number of subjects used for analysis

2-4

analysis for reference arm, n, Events, Median (moneth)

5-7

same analysis as for reference arm now for comparison arm

8

Hazard Ratio

9

95% Wald CI

Examples


library(random.cdisc.data)

ASL <- radam("ASL")
ATE <- radam("ATE", ADSL = ASL)

ATE_f <- subset(ATE, PARAMCD == "OS")

ANL <- merge(ASL, ATE_f)

tbl <- t_forest_tte(
  tte = ANL$AVAL,
  is_event = ANL$CNSR == 0,
  col_by = factor(ANL$ARM),
  group_data = as.data.frame(lapply(ANL[, c("SEX", "RACE")], as.factor)),
  dense_header = TRUE
)

tbl
#>                                                                                               ARM A                                                       ARM B                                                                
#> Baseline Risk                                         Total                 n                 Events              Median                n                 Events              Median              Hazard               95%     
#> Factors                                                 n                                                        (month)                                                     (month)              Ratio              Wald CI
